item.title: NMF way of identifying topics of passages
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Tang
item.description:
This is a sample of how I do Natural Language Processing(NLP)

  • NLP helps us extract meaning of words without reading them manually (very rough kinda definition)
  • In this case, we are trying to guess the topic of the passage based on the words that are in it
  • And we don't even need to tell it what topics to look for
  • We just need to specify how many (and even a wrong number won't work too badly)
  • This is just code, I will come back to the explanation of the concepts behind

Read more… (3 min remaining to read)

item.title: The Coin Change Problem
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Tang
item.description:
Given some US coins and an amount of value in cents, return the minimum number of coins necessary for the exact value

  • Loop through the coins sorted by descending order (25, 10...)
  • Take the rounded division (Add that to the number of cumulative coins)
  • Take the modulus and pass onto the next coin in line

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Profit Curves
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Tang
item.description:
Profit Curves

  • Combining prediction made by model and business requirements
  • Calculate Expected Profit based on how much a correct prediction makes us and how much a false one costs us
  • Based on where the Maximum Expected Profit (MEP) is, we can then set the threshold for predicting +ve
  • Other constraints such as how much the budget is, so we can only do MEP given budget limits

Read more… (3 min remaining to read)

item.title: Support Vector Classifiers
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Tang
item.description:
Support Vector Classifier

  • One of the most accurate (On par with Neural Nets)
  • Takes a long time to train (Much longer then Random Forest / Logit)
  • Takes even longer to CrossValidate
  • Sensitive to hyperparameters (Much tuning required - GridSearchCV)
  • Still used in industry when the accurate is needed
  • Continously training the SVM with a moving window of data
  • Partial_fit might be able to speed things up
  • Averaging of parameters on diff. subset of data can help too (Not in Python)
  • Data should be scaled (z-score, Normal Standard), where in Random Forest, doesn't really matter

Read more… (3 min remaining to read)

item.title: Numpy Basics
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Tang
item.description:
Numpy Basics

  • Numpy comes with better built-ins than regular lists
  • A lot of the times, numpy functions will take a regular list
  • There are faster because they have broadcasting and the underlying C code
  • Useful if you need to loop multiple times
  • Slow/ annoying if you wanna append an element to np.array
  • Sometimes have to reshape the array to 2d to do matrix dot product
  • Always use shape if you wanna know the number of rows/ columns
  • This will be a growing list

Read more… (5 min remaining to read)

item.title: The Anagram Problem

Anagrams are words with different arrangement of letters.

E.g. "dog" and "god" / "star", "arts" and "rats".
